pageContext.claim: “We've been in discussions with pharmacies and retailers to make drive-through tests available in the critical locations identified by public health professionals.”
pageContext.analysis: A National Public Radio investigation found that a month later Trump had over promised and the discussions have not led to any wide-scale implementation of drive-through tests. "Walmart has opened two testing sites — one in the Chicago area and another in Bentonville, Ark. Walgreens has opened two in Chicago; CVS has opened four sites," the report said. "Target has not opened any. In fact, the company said it had no formal partnership with the federal government and suggested that it was waiting for the government to take the lead."
